name: Overall core usage
description: This PromQL query measures the overall usage of CPU cores on a system by calculating the total CPU time spent in seconds across all cores within a specified time range.
question: What is the total CPU time spent across all cores?

name: Overall core usage
description: This PromQL query measures the overall usage of CPU cores on a system by calculating the total CPU time spent in seconds across all cores within a specified time range.
question: How has the overall CPU core usage changed over the specified time range?

name: Overall core usage
description: This PromQL query measures the overall usage of CPU cores on a system by calculating the total CPU time spent in seconds across all cores within a specified time range.
question: Which core has the highest usage based on total CPU time?

name: container CPU proportion
description: This PromQL query measures the proportion of CPU usage for containers in a given environment.
question: What is the current CPU usage proportion of containers?

description: This PromQL query measures the proportion of CPU usage for containers in a given environment.

name: container CPU proportion
description: This PromQL query measures the proportion of CPU usage for containers in a given environment.

name: microservice Pod
description: This PromQL query measures the memory request rate, CPU core usage, and disk usage of a specific microservice Pod in a Kubernetes cluster.
question: What is the rate at which memory is being requested by the microservice Pod?

name: microservice Pod
description: This PromQL query measures the memory request rate, CPU core usage, and disk usage of a specific microservice Pod in a Kubernetes cluster.
question: How much CPU core is the microservice Pod currently utilizing?

name: microservice Pod
description: This PromQL query measures the memory request rate, CPU core usage, and disk usage of a specific microservice Pod in a Kubernetes cluster.
